The strange absence of principle which characterizes this generation, and which is shown in their disregard of the laws of life and health, is astonishing. Ignorance prevails upon this subject, while light is shining all around them. With the majority, their principal anxiety is, What shall I eat? what shall I drink? and wherewithal shall I be clothed? . . . How great is the contrast between this generation and those who lived during the first 2,000 years! (Testimonies, vol. 3, pp. 138-141).
